docs.title: Welcome to ScanEO
docs.text:
ScanEO allows you to label satellite imagery with a user-friendly interface.

  • Display imagery and pick the bands and range you want to see
  • Add classification, segmentation and detection labels to your imagery
  • Use local files or S3 buckets
  • Works with any STAC compliant Catalog
  • Can perform multiple labelling tasks on a single image

docs.title: Why ScanEO?
docs.text:
One of the most limiting factors in the development of machine learning models for satellite imagery is the cost of labeled data. ScanEO aims to solve this problem by providing a dependable and fluid labelling workflow, reducing the time and cost of creating labeled data.

This documentation aims to guide users through the installation, setup, and operational procedures of ScanEO.

docs.title: Get Started
docs.text: For a complete walkthrough of the tool, continue with this documentation.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
You can install the library and CLI using pip.

pip install scaneo

To verify the installation you can run the help command, which will give you a list of all the available commands in the CLI.

scaneo --help

Until we hit a stable release it is recommended to upgrade the cli regularly to get the latest changes.

pip install eotdl --upgrade

The library and CLI require Python >= 3.8.

docs.title: CLI
docs.text:
pip install scaneo

You can pick a port to run the server on with the flag --port or -p.

scaneo --port 8080

Find out which version of the CLI you are running with the flag --version or -v.

scaneo --version

docs.title: Loading datasets
docs.text:
If you're working with local data, you can specify a path to a local file with the flag --data or -d before the path to the data.

scaneo --data ./path-to-data/

Youy may add a path to an environment file with credentials to a cloud bucket with the flag --env, .env or -e.

scaneo --env
.env
URL=''
ACCESS_KEY=''
SECRET_KEY=''
REGION=''
BUCKET=''

docs.title: Label Selector
docs.text:
Engage with existing labels and create new ones with associated colors.

If you're working with spare data, you can create labels by selecting a color, adding a name and clicking the '+' button or hitting the Enter key. Labels and colors will be stored in a labels.json file at the root of your data directory.

If you're working with a STAC catalog that uses the label extension, the tool will automatically import all the labels from the catalog and assign them a color. Feel free to change the color of the labels to your liking.

The colors of the labels of a STAC catalog will be stored in the label collection, under the 'summaries' property with the key 'scaneo:colors'.

docs.title: Image Selector
docs.text: You may click on an image name to begin labelling. There's a field to filter the images by name.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
Configure image band specifications, define selection ranges, and adjust the opacity of highlighted areas.

These options are specific for your browser, as they're stored in Local storage.

docs.title: Quick Selection
docs.text:
Shift between images swiftly with a comprehensive boundary view. You may start labelling an image by clicking on their boundaries or by using the search function.

It has two zoom options:

  • Zoom out on Quick Selection: Upon selecting this tool, the Quick Selection will zoom out to display all images.
  • Zoom in on selecting image: Upon selecting an image, the tool will zoom in to display the selected image.

docs.title: Saving and exporting
docs.text:
Upon saving, GeoJSON of type 'FeatureCollection' is created, named as 'image_name_labels.geojson'. The list of features will be each of the labelling tasks that have been saved.

Each of these features will have the following keys under 'properties'

  • 'labels': A list with the labels that apply to the feature.
  • 'tasks': A list with the tasks that apply to the feature.

If you're working with spare data, this Geojson will be in the root of your data directory.

If you're working with a STAC catalog, a label collection will be created if it doesn't exist already. The Geojson will be stored in a STAC item, under the 'assets' property with the key 'labels'.

docs.title: Classification
docs.text: Toggle one or more labels to the selected image.

docs.title: Segmentation
docs.text: Determine and designate areas of interest correlated with specific labels using brush and eraser tools. You can also change the size of your brush and delete the whole area for the selected label and image.
